abstract: Pressure on Apple and other technology companies to give law enforcement access to encrypted communications intensifies after recent terrorist attacks; Apple officials continue to argue that weakening encryption would leave networks vulnerable to enemies, and cite vast amount of useful, unencrypted data currently available to law enforcement.
lead_paragraph: Faced with proposed crackdowns on encrypted communications after terrorist attacks in Paris and California, Apple argued that lawmakers calling for such access do not understand the technical challenges.

headline.main: Apple Pushes Against British Talk of Softening Encryption
headline.print_headline: Apple Pushes Against Talk of Softening Encryption

snippet: Faced with proposed crackdowns on encrypted communications after terrorist attacks in Paris and California, Apple argued that lawmakers calling for such access do not understand the technical challenges.
